body:
## ✅ **IMPLEMENTED: Bearer Token Authentication for Ollama**

Hi @alelucrod,

Thank you for this excellent feature request! I'm excited to let you know that **Bearer token authentication for Ollama has been fully implemented** and is now available in the latest version.

### 🚀 **What's New**

**📦 Published:** `@aivue/core v1.3.5` with Bearer token support  
**🌐 Demo:** Updated live demo at https://aivue.netlify.app/  
**📚 Docs:** Enhanced documentation with remote Ollama examples

### 🔧 **Implementation Details**

The Ollama provider now automatically includes the `Authorization: Bearer ${apiKey}` header when an API key is provided, exactly as you requested:

```typescript
// Prepare headers
const headers: Record<string, string> = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
};

// Add Bearer token authentication if API key is provided
if (this.apiKey && this.apiKey !== 'local') {
  headers['Authorization'] = `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`;
}
```

### 💻 **Usage Examples**

**Local Ollama (no authentication needed):**
```javascript
const client = new AIClient({
  provider: 'ollama',
  baseUrl: 'http://localhost:11434',
  model: 'llama3'
});
```

**Remote Ollama with Bearer token:**
```javascript
const client = new AIClient({
  provider: 'ollama',
  apiKey: 'your-bearer-token', // 🔑 Your Bearer token here
  baseUrl: 'https://your-ollama-server.com',
  model: 'llama3'
});
```

**Vue Component Usage:**
```vue
<template>
  <AiChatWindow
    provider="ollama"
    :api-key="bearerToken"
    base-url="https://your-ollama-server.com"
    model="llama3"
    title="Secure Ollama Chat"
  />
</template>
```

### 🎯 **Key Features**

- ✅ **Bearer Token Support** - Automatic `Authorization` header inclusion
- ✅ **Backward Compatible** - Local instances work without API keys
- ✅ **Graceful Fallback** - Falls back to demo mode if authentication fails
- ✅ **Both Streaming & Non-streaming** - Works with all chat modes
- ✅ **Updated Demo** - Live example with Bearer token configuration

### 🔗 **Try It Now**

1. **Install the latest version:**
   ```bash
   npm install @aivue/core@latest
   ```

2. **Check out the live demo:**
   Visit https://aivue.netlify.app/ and navigate to the Ollama section to see the Bearer token authentication in action!

3. **View the source code:**
   The implementation is available in the latest commit: https://github.com/reachbrt/vueai/commit/26ddb70

### 🙏 **Thank You**

This was a great suggestion that makes the library much more useful for production deployments with secured Ollama instances. The feature is consistent with how other AI providers handle authentication, making the API more intuitive.

Feel free to test it out and let me know if you have any feedback or run into any issues!
